Trial_Design.evidence: This multicentre RCT evaluated the effect of lymphatic venous anastomosis on prevention of cellulitis.

Participants.evidence: Patients with secondary lower extremity lymphoedema who underwent at least 3 months of non-operative decongestive therapy were assigned randomly.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were assigned randomly to lymphatic venous anastomosis or conservative therapy.

Objective.evidence: This multicentre RCT evaluated the effect of lymphatic venous anastomosis on prevention of cellulitis.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary and secondary outcomes were cellulitis frequency, and assessments of circumference, hardness, and pain respectively.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Overall, 336 patients were divided into two groups.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 225 in the full-analysis set (primary outcome 225; secondary outcomes 170) and 156 in the per-protocol set (primary outcome 156; secondary outcomes 110).

Result_Outcome.evidence: the difference between groups in reducing cellulitis frequency over 6 months was −0.35 (95 per cent c.i. −0.62 to −0.09; P = 0.010) in the full-analysis set (FAS) and −0.60 (−0.94 to −0.27; P = 0.001) in the per-protocol set (PPS)

Harms.evidence: Four patients experienced contact dermatitis with non-operative decongestive therapy alone.
